```{r calculate-t-given-d-v, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
sf <- 3 # significant digits to use
v <- signif(runif(1, 0.1, 9.9), sf) # speed in m/s
d <- signif(runif(1, 10, 99), sf) # distance in m

ans <- d/v
dis <- c(v/d, v*d)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = 0.5, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sapply(sc$questions, signif, sf)
sc$questions <- paste("$", gsub("^ +", "", sc$questions), "\\text{ s}$", sep = "")
```

Question
========
Suppose an object travels at a constant velocity of `r v` m/s. How much time would it take for the object to travel a distance of `r d` m?

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use the formula for constant velocity motion.

$$ t = \frac{d}{v} = \frac{`r d` \text{ m}}{`r v` \text{ m/s}} = `r signif(d/v, 3)` \text{ s}$$
